verses.plain: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

tokens.t: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

verses.plain: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

tokens.t: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

verses.plain: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

tokens.t: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

verses.plain: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

tokens.t: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

verses.plain: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

tokens.t: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

verses.plain: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

tokens.t: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

verses.plain: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

tokens.t: thou the first man
was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

verses.plain: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

tokens.t: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

verses.plain: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

tokens.t: What knowest thou, that we know not?
understandest thou, which
not in us?

verses.plain: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

tokens.t: With us
both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

verses.plain: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

tokens.t: the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

verses.plain: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

tokens.t: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

verses.plain: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

tokens.t: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest
words go out of thy mouth?

verses.plain: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

tokens.t: What
man, that he should be clean? and
born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

verses.plain: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

tokens.t: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

verses.plain: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

tokens.t: How much more abominable and filthy
man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

verses.plain: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

tokens.t: I will shew thee, hear me; and that
I have seen I will declare;

verses.plain: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

tokens.t: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid

verses.plain: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

tokens.t: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

verses.plain: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

tokens.t: The wicked man travaileth with pain all
days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

verses.plain: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

tokens.t: A dreadful sound
in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

verses.plain: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

tokens.t: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

verses.plain: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

tokens.t: He wandereth abroad for bread,
, Where
? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

verses.plain: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

tokens.t: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

verses.plain: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

tokens.t: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

verses.plain: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

tokens.t: He runneth upon him,
on
neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

verses.plain: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

tokens.t: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on
flanks.

verses.plain: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

tokens.t: And he dwelleth in desolate cities,
in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

verses.plain: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

tokens.t: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

verses.plain: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

tokens.t: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

verses.plain: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

tokens.t: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

verses.plain: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

tokens.t: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

verses.plain: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

tokens.t: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

verses.plain: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

tokens.t: For the congregation of hypocrites
desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

verses.plain: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.

tokens.t: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.

footnotes.text: A dreadful…: Heb. A sound of fears
